meanings.definition: Forty times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: The farmer's harvest was fortyfold larger this year compared to last year.
meanings.sent2: She received a fortyfold increase in her salary after getting promoted.
meanings.sent3: The kids were amazed by the fortyfold amount of candy they collected on Halloween.
meanings.sent4: The impact of her words on him was fortyfold, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The mountain range stretched out before them, its beauty magnified fortyfold by the setting sun.

meanings.sent1: The car sped fortyfold faster than the bicycle.
meanings.sent2: He saved up enough money to buy the toy car fortyfold sooner than expected.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel darted fortyfold quickly up the tree, surprising the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement grew fortyfold as she got closer to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The music blared fortyfold louder than they had anticipated, causing them to cover their ears.
